_user_ and Jordan, welcome back!.
Hello again.
We are going to be learning about the order of events and order of importance.
Great, sounds very useful.

Yes it is, Jordan! Order of events refers to the order in which certain things happen. This is important when it comes to scheduling or planning. In our lesson, order of importance refers to how to handle different situations based on the same text.Let's go ahead and get started. Start by reading this text. When you are finished, click on the button that says click to continue at the bottom! Go ahead and start!
Let's start with the topic.
Awesome. I remember the topic is kind of what the writer is writing about.
Great Jordan! What is the topic of this text?
The topic is bus schedules!
Nice, Jordan! The topic of this text is bus schedules, it seems kind of obvious but the topic is an important place to start. You're on a roll! Let's move on.
Let's get some more practice in how to read this schedule.
Cristina, I need to go to main street tomorrow. When does the bus arrive there?
Let's look at the schedule and find out!
I need to go to the industrial district tomorrow.
The popular line goes to the industrial diistrict.
I need to be there before eight. When does the popular line arrive in the industrial district?
_user_ can you help Jordan find the time the popular line arrives in the industrial district?
I want to take my dogs to the park soon. However, I do not know what bus goes to the park.
Let's look at the schedule and find out!
Sometimes buses stop more than once. It's important to know if a bus stops more than once.
How do we find out if a bus stops more than once?
The schedule shows if a bus stops multiple times or not. Let's practice by looking at information about the Raines line.
The schedule provides all the information we need about the Raines line. Read the text carefully and answer the question.
The writer includes a lot of information on the schedule. Let's look at the reasons the writer may have for including certain information.
The bus schedule is not always the same.
Why is it not always the same?
Sometimes events or holidays can cause changes.
Writers often used headings to indicate imporant information.
So, if headings are used, there is often important information under them?
Yes, Jordan that is correct.

So now we are going to talk about summaries. A summary for a schedule is a tricky thing because technically the whole text is summarized, however there are summaries in this text that can be picked out.
But how do we know what to put in a summary for a text like this?

Good question! A summary would include information based on where you are going. A complete summary would include other information as well, but we can find the outline of summaries already in the text.
_user_ and Jordan brilliant job! We are going to move on to another text.
Alright! I'm pretty confident! Bring it on!
Read this text, when you are finished reading, click the click to continue button at the bottom of the page.
We are talking about importance in this passage. However, first we must identify the topic of the text?
The topic tells us what we are talking about!
Jordan, that is correct.
What actions do we take to find a doctor?
Well, Jordan there are several steps to finding a good doctor. Let's talk about the most important step first!
Now that we have identified the most important step to finding a dog, interviewing the doctor. Why is it the most important step?
I'm not sure.
_user_ can you help Jordan?
Now let's talk about the second most important thing to do when finding a doctor.
Finding a doctor is hard, I'm not sure what the next step is.
_user_please help Jordan.
So we know next we must next check the doctor's credentials.
Do we just ask the doctor?
Let's read the text and find out.
Okay, we have checked the doctor's credentials. What do we do next?
Excellent question! Let's look at the text and find out.
The office environment is important to check out before choosing a doctor.
Why is that?
Let's read and find out!
Let's move on to the least important thing to do. When I say least, that doesn't mean it is, not, important. It means that the other things we discussed are, more, important.
Oh that makes sense. I was going to ask you about that. Your mind reading skills are excellent, Cristina.
Let's move on to the question!
Let's talk about why talking to the receptionist is the least most important thing to do. Read the text to find out!
Talking to the receptionist can have its benefits. Look at the text to find out why you may want to talk to the receptionist.
So now we are going to talk about summaries. A summary of this order of importance text includes all of the important things the text includes.
Summaries that do not include all important information or include irrelevant information are bad summaries.
Look at the summary provided, there appears to be information in the text that is not needed,
Finding the irrelevant information is difficult. I need help.
Jordan, don't worry, we will help you!
Let's talk about the topic of this text!"
The topic is what to do when things happen at work, right?
Great, Jordan! Let's dig right into the text! We'll start by looking at the first thing the text tells us to do when having a problem with general conduct.
The next situation is a tough one. Someone is having a problem with sexual harrassment at work and the supervisor is involved.
Oh no! What do we do?
Let's read the text and find out what we should do.
These are very difficult.
Yes, these types of situations can be diifficult to handle. Let's continue to read the text and find out what to do if a conflict of interest exists.
It appears your supervisor is up to no good. There is evidence that he is committing fraud. Who do you speak to about this problem?
I do not know. I need help.
_user_, please help Jordan.
There are certain times when you should speak to the department head first. When should you report a problem to the department head? Let's look at the text and find out.
Pat keeps stealing my friend, Frank's, lunches. Frank has asked Pat to stop, but he still does it.
Poor Frank.What does the text say Frank should do about Pat stealing his lunches?
I think my supervisor is stealing money. I am not sure what to do.
Jordan, that's a terrible situation. Let's consult the test to see what you should do.

_user_ Here is another situation and I will ask you what to do about it. There is a woman named Maxine. She is being sexually harassed by a man named Larry at her work. He has been making very suggestive comments and making inappropriate advances in passing. Recently, he has been following her to her car and threatening her.
What a creep!
She talked to human resources but all they said was to ignore it. Maxine feels very threatened by his behavior. What should she do?
I think she should punch him in the face.
That's not an appropriate action.
The order of importance often changes.
It does not stay the same?
Jordan, no, it does not stay the same. Let's look at the text and find out why it changes.
Both of you did so well today! We got through some pretty tough passages!
Yeah we did. But I feel pretty good about it, really successful!

Remember, in this lesson, both order of events and order of importance are not always cut and dry. Circumstance can have a big impact on how we summarize. Also, signal words are great clues to tip you off to important information. Great job today, again! I will see you two next time!
See you two later!

Answer.text: The order of importance is based on circumstance.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: _user_, please try again. In every area of conduct, do you have the same order of importance for how to report it?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, is the order of importance always the same.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I bet its always the same.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: No. I think it's based on the circumstance.

Rule.name: DoneReading1
Rule.description: First passage finished. Opening1. Next page. To PageLoaded

Rule.name: LoadPageMedium
Rule.description: Medium page is loaded. To Read

Rule.name: GetTutoringPackMedium
Rule.description: Get medium tutoring pack. To HasTutoringPack

Rule.name: HasItem
Rule.description: Show item. Check agent. To AskQ

Rule.name: JordanAskQ
Rule.description: Jordan asks main question (not implemented in media and tutoring packs). To UserAnswer

Rule.name: CristinaAskQ
Rule.description: Cristina asks main question. to UserAnswer

Rule.name: CorrectJordanAgrees
Rule.description: User correct. JordanAgree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: CorrectJordanDisagrees
Rule.description: User correct. Jordan incorrect. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: Correct2JordanAgrees
Rule.description: User correct. JordanAgree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: Correct2JordanDisagrees
